titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Inapunch real estate collection 1986.035
titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was originally processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-08-09 14:49:52 +0000.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Brooklyn City Railroad Co. (New York, N.Y.)

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Brooklyn City and Newtown Railroad Company

did.abstract: The Inapunch real estate collection contains correspondence, bonds, and insurance policies of the Onslow-Moore Company, a land developing company based on Court Street in Brooklyn Heights. Also included are stock certificates for Brooklyn City and Newtown Railroad Company and Brooklyn City Rail Company, and an insurance policy for Morgenstern & Company.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of the Paterson Museum, 1986. The anonymous original donor requested that the collection be titled the "Inapunch collection."

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This small collection is housed in a single folder with no particular arrangement.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Inapunch real estate collection, 1986.035, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2024.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Inapunch real estate collection contains correspondence, bonds, and insurance policies of the Onslow-Moore Company, a land developing company based on Court Street in Brooklyn Heights. Also included are stock certificates for Brooklyn City and Newtown Railroad Company and Brooklyn City Rail Company, and an insurance policy for Morgenstern & Company.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The materials in this collection are in the public domain.
